article_title: At Wimbledon, Being Big Is Just a Big Pain
article_text:
To contend for a title on the fast, slick grass courts of Wimbledon, there is one kind of man you don’t want to be: a giant with a monstrous serve.

Wimbledon was once a haven for big servers, men like Goran Ivanisevic, who won the 2001 title and lost in three finals; Michael Stich, who won once; and Roscoe Tanner and Kevin Curren, who each reached a final. But as the lawns at the All England Club have gotten firmer and the bounces...

twitter.description: It used to be that tall players with huge serves would dominate the men’s game on grass courts. But as Wimbledon begins on Monday, such single-dimensional players have been marginalized.
twitter.title: At Wimbledon, Being Big Is Just a Big Pain

image.alt: At Wimbledon, being big is just a big pain
